meanings.definition: To transfer or pass from one to another
meanings.sent1: She was transfusing the juice from the bottle to the glass.
meanings.sent2: The nurse was transfusing blood from one bag to another for the patient.
meanings.sent3: The chef was transfusing flavors from the saucepan to the dish.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to be transfusing energy from the audience to his performance.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic was transfusing oil into the engine, making it run smoothly.

meanings.definition: To infuse or introduce into a person or thing
meanings.sent1: He was transfusing knowledge into the students' minds.
meanings.sent2: The doctor was transfusing medicine into the patient's body.
meanings.sent3: The artist was transfusing creativity into the painting.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight was transfusing warmth into the room through the window.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was transfusing nutrients into the soil for the plants to grow.

meanings.definition: To pour from one container to another
meanings.sent1: She was transfusing the water from the jug to the glass.
meanings.sent2: The bartender was transfusing the drink from the shaker to the glass.
meanings.sent3: The child was transfusing the sand from the bucket to the castle mold.
meanings.sent4: The rain was transfusing water from the clouds to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The chef was transfusing the sauce from the pot to the serving dish.
